attributes.action: Parliament to debate accountability & efficacy of Sharia Councils under UK law.
attributes.background: Sharia law varies in interpretation within Islam but tends to be male dominated and discriminates against vulnerable women who may not be aware of their rights under civil law, Parliament to consider any legal incompatibilities between Sharia and UK law and how vulnerable women can be protected.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament are aware of concerns that Sharia Councils may make different judgements after civil courts have made their judgements and vulnerable women may feel peer pressure to comply with theocratic law. We pride ourselves on equality and one law for all, regardless of gender or religion but in practice all women do not access it.

attributes.action: Financial support &employment support/protection for women with endometriosis
attributes.background: 1 in 10 women suffer with endometriosis in the UK. Women are losing their jobs, having financial difficulties, being treated unfairly by employers and are not protected even though this is a long term chronic illness with no cure. We need protection and help please. Repeat surgeries and treatments.
attributes.additional_details:
Endometriosis falls under the NHS most 20 painful conditions https://www.nhs.uk/Livewell/Pain/Pages/20-painful-conditions.aspx 
 
This illness is serious, we are having surgeries every year some of us and more than once a year. However, we've no protection in work and it is not recognised by all employers as serious and we are not fully protected by the disability act or any act. 

Some women have been fired, we have no benefits available to us either if we are no longer able to work.

attributes.action: Make cervical scans compulsory for anyone that has received cervical treatment
attributes.background: In Feb 2012 I underwent a LLETZ procedure to remove CIN 2 pre-cancerous cells from my cervix. When I fell pregnant in October 2014 I had an appointment with a medical registrar who advised there would be no effect on my pregnancy. In March 2015 my waters broke at 24 weeks & my son passed away.
attributes.additional_details:
At the time nobody was aware of what had caused my waters to break as I had received no monitoring during my pregnancy. Had I received cervical scans like I did in my subsequent pregnancy they would have been able to diagnose me with Incompetent Cervix & put a stitch in to save my son. 

Due to the amount of cells that were removed I was deemed to be 'low risk'. So if a low risk patient can lose a child then anybody can and this is totally unnecessary heartbreak that could have been prevented.

attributes.action: No more ofsted and introduce peer review instead
attributes.background: Ofsted is fundamentally flawed and is incredibly expensive. Teachers and leaders spend hours getting evidence ready for them rather than considering the best teaching approach. Each inspector comes with their own ideas and teaching can be subjective. Schools publishing peer reviews would be better.

attributes.action: Give mothers and fathers 50/50 custody of children in separation or divorce.
attributes.background: Fathers are just as important to the health development of children. Often limiting a father's access affects a child more than is realised creating societal and mental health issues for the child later in life. Don't make children decide between parents but have a balanced upbringing.
attributes.additional_details: Currently men generally only receive every other weekend in the courts and many use their children as a weapon to hurt fathers, when in fact children are being hurt. Men are considered second class citizens with mothers stating fathers must "win their children over" when mums have to make no effort. Children are used to inflict pain on another part and its not fair on the child to be in this position and having to take sides. I propose to give equal access and go to court for more as in the USA.

attributes.action: A referendum on the ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
attributes.background:
There are continuous debates on the use of the Foreign Aid Budget, from many different sides. Lets have the people that earn / provide the money decide how it should be used, if we are to have one at all.
I suggest four choices: (5th if we use remaining monies for Elderly Care)
attributes.additional_details:
1.	Change nothing maintain the 0.7% of GDP on overseas aid
2.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government on using the 0.7% of GDP for anything else & all remaining monies to be ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
3.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government using the 0.7% of GDP all remaining monies to be spent on replacing the EU subsidies, based upon % share of monies provided by the EU
4. No Foreign Aid Budget

attributes.action: Petition for annual increase for pensioners outside the EU Block.
attributes.background: My pension has been deferred for 5 years, by various Governments and now I find, I will not get yearly pension rises, because I am not in an EU country!

attributes.action: Stop police and crime commissioners from controlling the fire brigade.
attributes.background: The Police and Crime Act 2017 gave the police and crime commissioner the ability to apply to the Home Secretary to take democratic control of a county fire service. We the undersigned ask that this power be repealed as undemocratic. Firefighters should be represented by local councillors.
attributes.additional_details: One police and crime commissioner cannot adequately represent an entire county fire service. When a decision of this type is made it is decided on economics alone. This fails to consider factors such as whether firefighters have been consulted on potential changes to their duties. Many such applications are made with a clear desire to merge Police and fire services. This would mean a drastic change in job role without any debate or consultation at the local council.

attributes.action: Zero hours contracts should be abolished.
attributes.background:
Zero hours contracts should be abolished to stop exploitation of the work force. They do not offer regular working hours and lead to poor working practices.
It is time Government legislated to outlaw them.

attributes.action: To instigate signage and digital displays directing to the nearest defibrillator
attributes.background: Studies show that the public are often not aware of where the nearest defibrillator is should a cardiac arrest occur.  Although provided with directions when making a 999 call, the person may not have local knowledge.  Precious time could be wasted in locating the defibrillator.
attributes.additional_details:
Cardiac charity SADS UK believes community defibrillators should have signposts to direct people to quickly access this lifesaving equipment.  Roadside signage posts could be used, also digital information boards at bus shelters and rail stations.
Initially 999 must be dialled to despatch the ambulance; the rescuer uses directions given to locate the nearest defibrillator. Rescuers seeing a sign giving directions to the defibrillator will be assured they are heading in the right direction, saving precious minutes in reaching the defibrillator.

attributes.action: Save the Borough of Poole.
attributes.background: We object to the proposed Future Dorset merger of Poole with adjacent councils. The public consultation was entirely flawed and Poole council's vote approving the merger was too narrowly based for such a sudden, profound and unnecessary reform. The residents of Poole do not want this merger.
attributes.additional_details:
The public consultation of 2016 was undebated, poorly advertised, designed simply to yield support for the plan and supported by analysis containing egregious errors.
The council decision showed a lack of unanimity for the abolision of a centuries-old borough. It was was not supported by any opposition councillors while the ruling group worked unreasonably to prevent any dissent within its own ranks.
The financial reasons used to justify the merger are erroneous and grossly misleading.

attributes.action: Ban the making and receiving of all phone calls whilst driving.
attributes.background: Cars kill. Research clearly shows a person is distracted from driving and their reaction times are slowed if on the phone, even if they are using it hands-free. No phone call is worth a distraction that could cause death. Help save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
The government has responded to the research intoducing harsher fines and penalties. A driver involved in an accident, if engaged in a phone call, will be prosecuted for driving without due care and attention as this will be considered to have contributed. In the case of a death they can be prosecuted for manslaughter and receive a prison sentence.

Research links:
 http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/15389580600651103
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1369847816000085

attributes.action: Give all drink and drug drivers automatic 10 year ban
attributes.background: My mother was left in a pool of blood on the pavement because someone choose to drink and drive , He then left the scene with 3 other people in the car with no remorse , I was 12 years old standing over my mother with no one around , Nothing has changed in the 37 years she was killed ,
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are losing their lives due to drunk and drug drivers , The punishment in the UK is to weak with most willing to take the chance " why is this " no one fears the punishment , It is time to make people think hard about what will happen and the consequences of their actions .

10 year ban on the first offence with no appeal .

attributes.action: Amend the Dangerous Dogs Act to define a dangerous dog based on characteristics.
attributes.background: This petition calls on the new government to amend the Dangerous Dogs Act to remove breed specific legislation and define a dog as dangerous based entirely on its behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of dogs each year are seized under breed specific legislation, based on how they look and put away in kennels, away from their owner for months to be assessed as to whether or not they are dangerous.

attributes.action: Remove fees for basic RGN nurse training and teach them in nursing schools.
attributes.background:
The NHS is unable to recruit sufficient nurses and many potential nurses are put off by university / diploma debts. 
Increase the student nurse uptake by paying a basic salary and contract them to work for the trust that trained them for 6 months once qualified.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the schools of nursing were removed from our teaching hospitals the number of people coming into nursing has declined. In 1990 student nurses made up a THIRD of the NHS workforce, once Project 2000 was introduced the quality and number of student nurses steadily slipped.
Nursing at degree level entry means the NHS has lost thousands of potentially fabulous nurses because those that want to nurse cannot afford to train. 
We need excellent basic nursing care skills before we need a degree!

attributes.action: Lower the cervical smear test age to 18!
attributes.background: We want to lower the age of smear tests from 25 to 18. If we cannot lower it to 18 we should at least let girls from 18 be allowed to get a test if they so wish!
attributes.additional_details: Every 2 in 100 girls that are diagnosed are under the age of 25. If there is history in the family of cervical cancer I believe girls should be allowed to be tested and not have to wait until they are 25! Please see sense! Sign this petition so that we may help others and potentially our children or our children's children in the future!

attributes.action: Abolish prescription charges
attributes.background: England is the only part of the UK who still charges prescription charges. Prescription charges make medications unaffordable. The Prescription Charges Coalition found that 1 in 3 people with a long term condition who paid for their medications did not pick up their medication due to costs.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.prescriptionchargescoalition.org.uk/uploads/1/2/7/5/12754304/still_paying_the_price_june_2017.pdf

attributes.action: Allow UK university students to have free prescriptions and dental care
attributes.background: U.K. Students do not currently receive free prescriptions and dental care. Whilst at university many students struggle with money and forego taking medication and dental checks as they cannot afford it. Allow students to have this at no cost to ensure they're receiving the treatment they need.

attributes.action: Create a Minister for Men that operates separately from the Minister for Women
attributes.background:
A 'Minister for Women (and Equalities)' cannot simultaneously be a 'Minister for Men' yet, that is what's in place.
Despite men raising issues in Parliament, men's issues are not raised.
A male-specific voice is required, equality demands it!
attributes.additional_details:
Such issues for the Minister for Men to address:
Paternity Rights (or, the lack of!)
Male Suicide (4x higher than female)
Homelessness (approx. 90% male)
Education (boys have been failing at every level since the 1990s)
Domestic Violence (40% victims are male)
False Allegations of Abuse
Disparity in health funding (prostate v breast cancer)
More information: https://ministerformen.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Educate children early on the dangers in and around open water/ cold water shock
attributes.background: I lost my son Cameron to cold water shock in July 2015 something we as a family knew nothing about , he was 14 fit, healthy and had his whole life ahead of him. I truly believe that had he had the educate on the real dangers in and around open water he'd still be here today
attributes.additional_details: Deaths in open water is a a leading cause of accidental death in the UK. More often it's the dangers unknown to many ie cold water shock and the deadly effects it has on the human body that leads to a loss of life rather than the swimming ability of the individual. Education is key to reduce the numbers of lives lost  Swimming and classroom lessons should teach children about the dangers of cold water shock new figures show a 25 per cent rise in the number of young people drowning accidentally

attributes.action: Change religious slaughter law to mirror the licensing requirements in Germany
attributes.background: Change the laws to mirror those in Germany as outlined in House of Commons Library SN07108SES dated 18/02/2015. Germany requires licensing and the matching of volumes produced to actual needs for religious slaughtered products.Britain has no such defined requirement for monitoring or enforcement
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons SN07108 dated 28/02/2015
DEFRA T02017 and RFI 9592
Volume of meat produced by religious slaughter over 50%
Religious groups requiring such produce 6%
Most meat on sale in UK supermarkets carry EEC codes that refer to establishments that practice religious slaughter but there is no requirement to restrict the sale or even label these products which denies british consumers choice and infringes on the religious freedoms of groups who religions forbid its use

attributes.action: Create a Charter for Families Bereaved through Public Tragedy
attributes.background: The Bishop's review of Hillsborough families' experiences recommends the creation of a Charter for Families Bereaved through Public Tragedy. The Government must implement this recommendation. This petition was started by bereaved relatives of family members who perished in the Grenfell Tower fire.
attributes.additional_details: The Charter will include commitments by public bodies to change in relation to transparency and acting in the public interest. By adopting this, the Government will show that it has learned the lessons of the Hillsborough disaster and ensure that the perspective of bereaved families is never lost. We’re concerned that the Grenfell public inquiry isn’t taking into account the views of bereaved families, survivors, and local community affected. They can be spared the indignities, pain and suffering Bishop James Jones describes in his report as "The Patronising disposition of unaccountable power".

attributes.action: Enact New UK Legislation to Ban Food Waste
attributes.background: No country in Europe wastes as much food as the UK, despite millions of children, homeless and vulnerable people sleeping hungry at night. In 2016 France banned food waste and made it compulsory for supermarkets to donate unsold food to charities. We urge the UK government to enact a similar law.
attributes.additional_details: The £17 billion of food thrown away in the UK (WRAP). In the last 5 years, homelessness has also doubled and three million school children also risk hunger. Inspiringly, France has passed a law to ban food waste with fines and imprisonment for defaulters. In the UK, too, nutritious rescued food can feed the homeless and children in schools. The Government must uphold the right to food for every citizen and urgently pass a strong law to tackle food poverty and food waste.

attributes.action: Stop the Mersey Gateway tolls
attributes.background: The Mersey Gateway crossing is due to open imminently. Users of the crossing who reside outside of Halton will have to pay for the use of this crossing. This is unfair and unjust. All other toll routes in the UK have a viable alternative. This one doesn't.
attributes.additional_details: Halton Council and the Mersey Gateway Project claim the crossing will bring prosperity to Halton. These claims are unfounded. Effectively the only thing the crossing will achieve is the alienation of Liverpool, St Helens, Warrington and the surrounding area. The new crossing will only carry around 50% of the traffic of the old crossing as people will find alternative routes. Once Warrington becomes busier will the Government then toll there. Where does tolling end?

attributes.action: The Government to take the UK out of the ECJ & end free movement in March 2019
attributes.background: The government have been given a mandate by the people of the UK. If we have not left the jurisdiction of the ECJ after March 2019 then we have not left the EU. We also mandated you to stop free movement. If not enforced correctly, this would be a denial of the peoples democratic vote.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of high caffeine energy drinks to under 16s
attributes.background: The label may state ‘not for children’ but 69% of teenagers / 24% of children under 10 are consuming high-caffeine energy drinks that lead to adverse health effects post consumption. With sales ever rising, we propose a ban on high-caffeine energy drinks containing over 150mg of caffeine per litre.
attributes.additional_details: A 2015 European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) report found that a 'safe' caffeine intake level for children has not been established. They propose guidelines of 3mg/kg per day could be used as a safe amount for habitual caffeine consumption by children and adolescents. This means that while a single can of popular brands on the market can contain around 160mg of caffeine, the EFSA recommends an intake of no more than 105mg caffeine per day for children. These drinks are simply #NotforChildren.

attributes.action: Make Puppy farming a criminal offence
attributes.background: A puppy farmer is a breeder who breeds puppies with little or no regard for the health and welfare of the puppies or their parents. Once the puppies are born, they are separated from their mothers at 4 weeks old. After, the bitches are given dangerous injections for them to go back into heat
attributes.additional_details:
Health of puppies sold by puppy farmers:
20% of puppies (four times more than the average) bought from pet shops or directly from the internet suffer from parvovirus, an often fatal disease which can cost up to £4,000 to treat (2014 Kennel Club PAW survey).

With no regulations, puppy mills have no cleanup control. This means that dogs can be living in urine and feces for indefinite periods of time.

Puppy mills have no veterinary care, climate control, or protection for the animals from weather

attributes.action: Make all supermarkets sell a full comprehensive range of vegan foods and drinks.
attributes.background: More people would go vegan if shopping was easier. This would help our planet and spare the torture of the animals. Make it law for major supermarkets to stock a full range of food and drink alternatives.

attributes.action: Re-open the Dubs scheme to allow unaccompanied child refugees entry into the UK
attributes.background: The Government announced in February that it would close the Dubs scheme – intended to grant 3000 vulnerable unaccompanied minors a safe passage to Britain – after accepting just 350. We are capable of taking thousands more. Sign to call for the scheme to be reopened & help these desperate children.
attributes.additional_details: FOI requests have shown that local councils have voluntarily offered to accept 1572 more children than are currently being supported, yet the Government is refusing to accept any more child refugees from the continent. The longer this goes on the more likely it is that children will go missing & fall into the hands of traffickers. Our values of openness & tolerance mean that we have a duty to be a land of sanctuary to these vulnerable children. The Government must act now and re-open the scheme.

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty for proved child rapists
attributes.background: Thousands of children get raped each year and even after time in jail, the offenders repeat the same offenses. Children's lives need to be more protected.

attributes.action: Provide statutory anonymity for victims of homophobic & transphobic hate crime.
attributes.background: Being 'outed' is a barrier for victims to LGB&T hate crime reporting an incident to the Police and later attending court. Introducing statutory anonymity, as already given to victims of serious sexual assault, would remove this barrier, as well as removing the possibility of hostile media reporting.
attributes.additional_details:
1. LGB & T Hate Crime Reporting: Identifying Barriers and Solution, Equality Human Rights Commission (2015), page 31.
2. The Hate Crime Report: Homophobia, biphobia and transphobia in the UK, GALOP (2016), pages 8 - 9.
3. Homophobic Hate Crime: the Gay British Crime Survey (2013) pages 18 - 19.

attributes.action: Allow Premier League and Championship football clubs to introduce safe standing
attributes.background: Safe Standing offers a much safer alternative to fans who wish to stand, rather than sit at football matches. After the highly successful introduction to rail seating at Celtic Park, as well as numerous Bundesliga clubs, many football fans feel that laws preventing standing areas should be relaxed.
attributes.additional_details:
Some football clubs that already have successfully installed rail seating are: Celtic, Werder Bremen, Hamburg SV, Vfl Wolfsburg, Hannover 96 and the famous “yellow wall” at Borussia Dortmund. 

In conclusion, there is a clear demand for safe standing with 92% of respondents saying fans should be given the choice to stand in safe standing areas, in a poll by the Football Fans Census, and it would only promote English football further by improving the overall matchday experience.

attributes.action: Drop the ban on 22lr target pistols
attributes.background: The ban on 22lr target pistols restricts shooters from doing the sport in England Scotland and Wales

attributes.action: Create a campaign to raise awareness of the symptoms of type 1 diabetes
attributes.background: The number of young people being diagnosed with type 1 diabetes is rising at an alarming rate. The symptoms are often missed or explained away as flu. If left undiagnosed the outcome is fatal. If diagnosis is delayed the result is life changing. We need a campaign to highlight the symptoms.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.news-medical.net/news/2007/03/19/22619.aspx

https://www.diabetes.org.uk/About_us/News_Landing_Page/UK-has-worlds-5th-highest-rate-of-Type-1-diabetes-in-children/

The statistics are frightening.
We need to raise awareness of the symptoms like we have had with meningitis and more recently sepsis.

attributes.action: Provide a linked network of traffic-free horse riding & carriage driving routes.
attributes.background: Riders & horses die every month! Over 1.3 million regular horse riders, with over 3 million occasional riders. The equine industry has 19 million consumers & is worth over £4.3 billion pa. 600,000 more than cars, the only way to prevent injuries and deaths of riders & horses is safe off road access.
attributes.additional_details:
National Equestrian survey 2015
Dept of transport
British Horse Industry Confederation

attributes.action: Keep freedom of movement for UK and EU Citizens as part of Brexit EU trade deal
attributes.background: The Leave side won the EU referendum in 2016, but there are voters on both sides who wish to keep EU freedom of movement rights post Brexit.  Freedom of movement is also essential for the NHS and companies across the UK and EU, we must fight to maintain it. Please sign if you agree.
attributes.additional_details: As the March 29th 2019 Brexit withdrawal deadline draws ever closer we must act before it's too late to save Freedom of movement rights for UK and EU Citizens post Brexit.  Think about the future and the opportunities that EU freedom of movement rights offer with the ability to work, live, study and retire across the EU 28.

attributes.action: Make removing items from a grave without permission illegal
attributes.background: We are creating this petition on behalf of all grieving parents and families who would like to decorate their child's grave, without the risk that cemetery staff may remove items without getting  permission from the family.
attributes.additional_details: We lost our baby girl Niamh at 22 weeks and 4 days and wanted to lay her to rest in a place where she wouldn't be disturbed by cemetery staff removing her belongings for health and safety reasons, in case the lawnmower ran the stones over and caused an interference or, in the words of the cemetery manager, "caused a death".

attributes.action: A Public Inquiry into Carillion plc & the awarding of HS2 contracts
attributes.background: We the British Taxpayers want the Government to urgently launch a public inquiry into the awarding of all HS2 (High Speed Two Limited) contracts to Carillion plc despite grave concerns over their finances at the time the contracts were awarded.
attributes.additional_details: Despite profit warnings the Government awarded Carillion plc contracts on HS2 (High Speed 2) for £1.4 BILLION of public money. Following compulsory liquidation today 15 January 2018 we require an urgent public inquiry into how this was allowed to happen placing the country's economy in danger, putting thousands of jobs at risk and damaging confidence in UK construction markets. It is vital any potential criminal activity is investigated and acted on. Accountability is required by the taxpayer.

attributes.action: Allow and run a referendum in Wales to decide the future of the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Over the past 20 years the many in Wales have become dissatisfied by the unnecessary bureaucracy known as the Welsh Assembly (WA).  Due to its ineffective and costly intervention at all levels of Welsh life it's time to have another referendum to allow us to decide if the WA should continue or not.
attributes.additional_details: There are many reasons why the Welsh Assembly (WA) should be dissolved.  These include excessive running costs each year.  A growing North/South Wales divide in terms of investment.  Anything that the WA does could be done by Welsh MPs in government.  The WA has gone against the wishes of Wales on leaving the EU. It appears to be nothing but a talking shop for already failed ideas and now wants to take on the role of government imposing laws and taxes that would further divide us from the UK.

attributes.action: Introduce a carbon tax on applicable products to help battle climate change.
attributes.background: Introduce a tax on products that are increasing the levels of carbon dioxide in the earths atmosphere. Offset the tax by reducing others on products/services that are better for the environment making it financially beneficial for people to make the right decisions on what they buy.
attributes.additional_details: This kind of tax would be similar to car tax in the way that an engine with lower emission levels is cheaper than one that has a higher level, and cars such as those powered by electricity have zero tax. This would make healthier foods more attainable to people and junk food more expensive, thus improving the publics health reducing the strain on services like the NHS. Another example, electricity provided by companies using renewable technologies would be cheaper than those using fossil fuels.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to wear service medals that you have not been awarded.
attributes.background: I am a Veteran of the Northern Ireland troubles and the Falklands War 1982. In both conflicts I lost friends. They did not see the medals that they had earned. It annoys me to see anybody wearing medals that they have not earned. I find it disrespectful to my friends and all the others who gave all.
attributes.additional_details: We are asked to sign a blank cheque, up to the value of our life. For this we may get a medal. To see somebody walking around wearing medals, who didn't serve or sign on, is disgusting. They have never put their life on the line. They have never been on active service and faced the enemy. Why should they be allowed to bring contempt upon the uniform of somebody who has come forward and protected the people of this country?

attributes.action: Order for a new and updated Family Justice Review Report to be completed.
attributes.background: The last Family Justice Review was filled in November 2011. Almost 7 years ago. A new Family Justice Review is long overdue and a new updated report should be conducted to further improve the Family Justice System.
attributes.additional_details: The last and Final Family Justice Review Report was completed by Mr Norgove in November 2011. The government should now consider a new and updated Family Justice Review Report to be completed. There are many changes and improvements that could be discussed for instance; Fathers are not granted automatic parental responsibility like mothers are. The impact of Parental Alienation abuse and how the Justice system intends to address this. Further ways to encourage and facilitate contact for children

attributes.action: Mandatory for alcoholic drinks to display the dangers of alcohol when pregnant
attributes.background: To help prevent foetal alcohol in children and raise awareness

attributes.action: Rehouse our brave Armed Forces as a matter of priority
attributes.background: Veterans are supposed to have “priority” from Local authorities when it comes to affordable housing and health care under the Armed Forces Covenant but all too often this does not happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Estimates taken from charities Shelter and Crisis show almost 8,000 military heroes are currently homeless.  However, the Government does not keep accurate records. We believe that the Government should act as a matter of urgency and help our brave Armed Forces heroes in their hour of need. 
Rehouse our brave Armed Forces as a matter of urgency.
They have served our country. Now it is time for us to repay that debt.

attributes.action: Axe Safety Tax, remove VAT on safety products & services for residential homes
attributes.background: Residential safety products & services are taxed at 20%, such items include: smoke alarms; annual gas safety checks; fire blankets; carbon monoxide detectors. Despite still being part of the EU, the Government does have the ability to axe the tax on these lifesaving products and services.
attributes.additional_details: These are potentially life-saving products and they should be affordable. http://safetytax.org.uk #axesafetytax

attributes.action: Introduce a 10p disposable cup tax in the UK
attributes.background: Based on the success of the single use plastic bag tax of October 2015, a single use cup tax would help encourage more people to switch to reusable coffee cups, further reducing the UK's plastic waste output.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove, Twitter, 6:37pm 20/11/17:
"Still haunted by last night's #BluePlanet2 - the imperative to do more to tackle plastic in our oceans is clear. We @DefraGovUK will work urgently to identify further action."

Many coffee shops like Costa and Starbucks offer customers the option to provide their own cup, usually encouraged by a small discount. This incentive, combined with the extra cost of a cup tax, should encourage many people to make a small sustainable change.

attributes.action: Ban the use of all non-recyclable packaging materials by 31st December 2020.
attributes.background:
It's crazy that we are still buying products with mixed packaging materials where part of it is recyclable and part of it not. 
I believe this means we recycle significantly less than we could as some people do not bother to sort it and just throw everything into the general rubbish.
attributes.additional_details: The need to reduce the use of landfill and to increase recycling is widely accepted and I believe this would be a major step forward to making a greener more sustainable future for our country and the world

attributes.action: Compulsary Subsidised Swimming Lessons for Children (ages 3-10 years) in the UK.
attributes.background:
Compulsory Swimming Lessons for Children up to the age of 10 in the UK is paramount in fighting the UK’s battle against accidental drownings.
“Taking part in in formal swimming lessons reduces the risk of drowning among children aged 1 to 4 years” (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, 2016)
attributes.additional_details:
Latest figures from the National Water Safety Forum (NWSF) show that 300 people died in accidental drownings in the UK last year.
The number of people aged 19 and under who drowned in the UK has risen by 25 per cent (Local Government Association 2017, National Water Safety, 2017)
Water Safety and Rescue Techniques combined with taught sessions will reduce the rate of accidental deaths due to drowning, and promote a deeper understanding at an early age of the risks associsated with Water Safety

attributes.action: Light beacons across the country on March 29th 2019 to celebrate Brexit
attributes.background:
At 11pm on March 29th 2019 our country will leave the EU.
To celebrate this historic and momentous occasion, we believe the Government should arrange for beacons to be lit from Lands End to John O'Groats and at all points in between.
attributes.additional_details:
After over 40 years of Brussels rule, we are finally leaving the EU.
Lighting beacons around the country would be a symbolic gesture celebrating our independence and sovereignty.

attributes.action: Theresa May to publicly condemn the government of Myanmar/Burma
attributes.background: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres said the Rohingyas were facing a catastrophic humanitarian situation, and attacks on villagers were unacceptable. The UN Security Council has called for urgent steps to end the violence.
attributes.additional_details: Amnesty said it had new evidence based on satellite imagery, photos and videos, as well as interviews with eye-witnesses, of "an orchestrated campaign of systematic burnings" targeting Rohingya villages for almost three weeks. "The evidence is irrefutable - the Myanmar security forces are setting northern Rakhine State ablaze in a targeted campaign to push the Rohingya people out of Myanmar. Make no mistake: this is ethnic cleansing," said Tirana Hassan, the group's crisis response director.
